PATIENT_ID: TEST_PEN_CHEST_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-22 22:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-22 22:05:00
Category I trauma activation for 22-year-old male, single GSW to left chest.
Penetrating chest injury, gunshot wound to left anterior thorax at 4th intercostal space.
BP 75/45, HR 140, RR 32, GCS 14.
Hemodynamically unstable. Signs of life present: pulse palpable, respiratory effort present.
Breath sounds diminished on left. Respiratory distress with tachypnea.
FAST exam positive for pericardial effusion, cardiac tamponade suspected.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-01-22 22:10:00
Left chest tube placed emergently. Output 1200mL blood immediately.
Portable AP chest x-ray obtained prior to OR.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-22 22:12:00
Portable chest x-ray: Large left hemothorax. Retained hemothorax after chest tube.
Possible cardiac silhouette enlargement suggesting pericardial effusion.

[OPERATIVE_NOTE] 2026-01-22 22:30:00
Left anterior thoracotomy performed in ED for hemodynamic collapse.
Pericardial tamponade confirmed. Cardiac laceration repaired.
Patient transferred to OR for definitive repair.
